alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Lehigh; Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Lehigh, southeastern Carbon, southwestern Monroe and west central Northampton Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 700 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Beltzville State Park, or near Lehighton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lehighton, Northampton, Palmerton, Jim Thorpe, Slatington, Walnutport, Kunkletown, Neffs, Coffeetown, Rossland, Berlinsville, Emerald, Kresgeville, Danielsville, Beltzville State Park, Penn Forest Reservoir, Beersville, Christmans, Schnecksville and Coplay. This includes Northeast Extension between mile markers 62 and 86. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
